DOC.brief_summary: Background : Studies show 1 3 patient Primary Care suffer primarily mental health disorder , anxiety disorder depression . Cognitive behavior therapy ( CBT ) show effective treatment disorder . Despite strong evidence CBT lack evidence-based psychological treatment primary care . For various reason , progress research affect clinical practice . For successful implementation CBT primary care cost-effective therapy , access therapist proper train supervision , evidence-based manual management support implementation need . Aim : The aim trial evaluate step care model CBT primary care . All patient first treat self-help CBT ( N = 400 ) . Patients improve treatment ( 9 week ) randomize individual CBT continue self-help treatment . Based publish study 2/3 expect improved self-help therefore undergo randomization . 1/3 ( n = 133 ) didnÂ´t respond treatment randomize individual CBT ( N = 67 ) continue self-help treatment ( N = 67 ) .
DOC.brief_title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy , Guided Self Help Versus Individual Therapy
DOC.criteria: Have anxiety disorder diagnosis ( obsessive compulsive disorder , social phobia , panic disorder , generalize anxiety disorder ) , or/and major depression , or/and maladaptive stress reaction , or/and primary insomnia Clinician severity rating scale 26 A high score 6 Clinician severity rating scale
